events.event_name: S&P Global US Services PMI Release (January 2026)
events.description: The release of the final US Services Purchasing Managers' Index for January 2026, showing growth in the sector.

facts.fact_text: The S&P Global US Services PMI rose to 52.7 in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P Global US Services PMI rose to 52.7 in January of 2026 from 52.5 in the previous month

facts.fact_text: The US services sector has experienced nearly three years of consecutive monthly growth.

evidences.evidence_text: The period marked nearly three years of monthly growth in the US services output

facts.fact_text: Employment numbers in the services sector increased marginally.

evidences.evidence_text: The steady capacity demand drove employment numbers to increase marginally.

facts.fact_text: Input inflation rose due to payroll increases and tariff-related cost pressures.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, increases in payrolls and cost pressures from tariffs lifted input inflation

claims.claim_text: US services output outperformed other major economies.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: outperforming those from other major economies.

claims.claim_text: Business confidence for the upcoming year fell to its lowest level in three months.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: Looking forward, business confidence for the upcoming year fell to its lowest in three months.

evidence.evidence_text: robust activity in the domestic market was enough to offset softness for foreign clients amid the tariffs passed by the US
The steady capacity demand drove employment numbers to increase marginally.
cost pressures from tariffs lifted input inflation
increases in payrolls... lifted input inflation
